title: Thames & Kosmos Structural Engineering: Bridges & Skyscrapers | Science & Engineering Kit | Build 20 Models | Learn about Force, Load, Compression, Tension | Parents' Choice Gold Award Winner, Blue
descriptions:
Discover the fascinating world of structural engineering with the Thames & Kosmos Structural Engineering: Bridges & Skyscrapers Science & Engineering Kit. This award-winning kit allows you to build 20 different models, each teaching you about force, load, compression, tension, and more. With over 285 interchangeable building pieces, you'll have endless possibilities for creating your own structures.

Whether you're an intermediate builder or just starting out, this kit is perfect for you. The 36-page, illustrated experiment manual and assembly guide will walk you through each step of the process, making it easy to learn and understand the principles of structural engineering. From basic structural elements to complex trusses and roofs, you'll gain a deep understanding of how these structures are designed and built.

Experiment with different types of bridge construction, including truss bridges, arch bridges, cantilever bridges, rope bridges, and suspension bridges. Challenge yourself to build the tallest tower using only the pieces included in the kit and learn about the strength and stiffness of materials. Discover how structural engineers optimize factors to maximize safety and minimize the risk of structural failure.

With its hands-on approach and comprehensive manual, the Thames & Kosmos Structural Engineering: Bridges & Skyscrapers Science & Engineering Kit is the perfect tool for aspiring engineers and curious minds. Unleash your creativity and dive into the world of structural engineering today!

Unlock the world of structural engineering with the Thames & Kosmos Structural Engineering: Bridges & Skyscrapers Science & Engineering Kit. This award-winning kit allows you to build 20 different models, each teaching you about force, load, compression, tension, and more. With over 285 interchangeable building pieces, you can explore the principles of structural engineering in a hands-on way. The included 36-page, illustrated experiment manual and assembly guide will guide you through each model-building experiment. From small models that demonstrate how structural elements maximize strength, to more complex trusses, roofs, bridges, and even towering skyscrapers, this kit offers endless possibilities. Perfect for intermediate skill levels, this kit is designed to ignite a passion for engineering and inspire future architects and builders. Don't miss out on this opportunity to learn and have fun at the same time!

Challenge yourself to build towering skyscrapers and discover the secrets of strength and stiffness in materials. With step-by-step instructions, this kit provides an engaging and educational experience for aspiring engineers. Don't miss out on this opportunity to learn and have fun with Thames & Kosmos Structural Engineering: Bridges & Skyscrapers Kit.

Title: Explore Structural Engineering with Thames & Kosmos Bridges & Skyscrapers Kit!

Description: Discover the fascinating world of structural engineering with the Thames & Kosmos Bridges & Skyscrapers Kit! This award-winning kit allows you to build 20 different models, each teaching you about force, load, compression, tension, and more. With over 285 interchangeable building pieces, you can unleash your creativity and learn hands-on about the principles of mechanical physics and structural engineering.

The kit includes a 36-page, illustrated experiment manual and assembly guide, making it perfect for intermediate skill levels. Starting with small models, you'll learn how to maximize the strength of structures using minimal materials. Explore various structural elements like columns, beams, trusses, arches, and more. Dive into the forces acting on these elements, including tension, compression, shear, and bending.

As you progress, you'll tackle more complex models such as trusses, roofs, and small buildings. Delve into different types of bridge construction, including truss, arch, cantilever, rope, and suspension bridges. And for the grand finale, challenge yourself to build towering skyscrapers using only the pieces in the kit.

Discover the secrets behind the strength and stiffness of materials, and learn how structural engineers optimize factors to ensure safety while minimizing cost and the risk of failure. The 36-page, full-color manual provides step-by-step instructions, allowing you to dive into the world of structural engineering with ease.

Don't miss out on this educational and exciting experience. Get your Thames & Kosmos Bridges & Skyscrapers Kit today and start building your way to becoming a structural engineering master!

From small models to towering skyscrapers, this kit is perfect for intermediate level builders. Unleash your creativity and learn about the strength and stability of structures with this comprehensive kit.

Start small with basic structural elements like columns, beams, trusses, and plates. Discover the forces acting on these components, including tension, compression, shear, and bending.

Expand your knowledge by constructing more complex models of trusses, roofs, and small buildings. With the Thames & Kosmos Structural Engineering Kit, you'll gain a deeper understanding of the strength and stiffness of materials while having fun building and experimenting. Title: Discover Structural Engineering with Thames & Kosmos Science & Engineering Kit

Description: Unleash your inner engineer with the Thames & Kosmos Structural Engineering: Bridges & Skyscrapers kit. With over 285 interchangeable building pieces, this kit allows you to build 20 different models while learning about force, load, compression, tension, and more. Whether you're a beginner or an intermediate builder, this kit is perfect for you. 

The included 36-page, illustrated experiment manual and assembly guide will guide you through each model-building experiment, teaching you the basics of structural engineering in a hands-on way. You'll start with small models that demonstrate the strength of structures with a fixed amount of material. Then, explore the forces acting on structural components and build more complex models of trusses, roofs, and small buildings. 

Take your engineering skills to the next level by experimenting with different types of bridge construction, including truss bridges, arch bridges, cantilever bridges, rope bridges, and suspension bridges. Finally, challenge yourself by building towering skyscrapers and see just how high you can go using only the pieces in this kit. 

With the Thames & Kosmos Structural Engineering: Bridges & Skyscrapers kit, you'll gain a deeper understanding of the strength and stiffness of materials, and learn how structural engineers optimize factors to ensure safety while minimizing cost and the risk of structural failure. Get ready to embark on an exciting engineering journey with this Parents' Choice Gold Award-winning kit.

Discover the fascinating world of structural engineering with the Thames & Kosmos Structural Engineering: Bridges & Skyscrapers Science & Engineering Kit. Build 20 different models that teach you about force, load, compression, tension, and more. With over 285 interchangeable building pieces, you can create a variety of structures while learning important engineering principles.

This kit includes a 36-page, illustrated experiment manual and assembly guide to help you along the way. It is designed for intermediate skill levels, making it perfect for aspiring engineers who want to take their knowledge to the next level.

Start with small models that demonstrate how structural elements can be connected to maximize strength with minimum materials. Explore different types of structural elements, including columns, beams, trusses, plates, arches, shells, and catenary. Learn about the forces that act on these components, such as tension, compression, shear, and bending.

As you progress, you'll build more complex models, like trusses, roofs, and small buildings. Experiment with various bridge designs, including truss, arch, cantilever, rope, and suspension bridges. Challenge yourself to build the tallest skyscraper using only the pieces provided in the kit.

The included manual offers step-by-step instructions and full-color illustrations to guide you through each model-building experiment. Learn how structural engineers optimize factors like strength, stiffness, safety, and cost to create structurally sound and efficient designs.

With its hands-on approach and comprehensive instruction manual, the Thames & Kosmos Structural Engineering Kit is a Parents' Choice Gold Award winner that offers an engaging and educational experience for budding engineers.

Title: Thames & Kosmos Structural Engineering: Bridges & Skyscrapers | Science & Engineering Kit | Build 20 Models | Learn about Force, Load, Compression, Tension | Parents' Choice Gold Award Winner, Blue

Description: Build 20 different models that each teach about force, load, compression, tension and more

Over 285 interchangeable building pieces

Includes 36-page, illustrated experiment manual and Assembly guide

Skill level: Intermediate

Do you ever wonder how bridges span huge distances and how skyscrapers stay standing? Structural engineers use physics and their knowledge of the properties of building materials and geometric shapes to design structures with sufficient strength and stability. With this kit of modular building pieces, you can learn the basics of structural engineering by conducting a series of 20 model-building experiments. Each model demonstrates a basic principle of mechanical physics or structural engineering in a hands-on way. Start out with small models that demonstrate how structural elements can be attached together to maximize the strength of a structure for a fixed amount of material used. Learn about basic structural elements including columns, beams, trusses, plates, arches, shells, and catenary. Explore the forces acting on structural components including tension, compression, shear, and bending. Move onto building more complex models of trusses, roofs, and small buildings. Experiment with different types of bridge construction: a truss bridge, arch bridge, cantilever bridge, rope bridge, and suspension bridge. Finally, build models of towering skyscrapers. What is the tallest tower you can build using only the pieces included in the kit? Learn about the strength and stiffness of materials. See how structural engineers optimize factors to maximize safety, and minimize cost and the risk of structural failure. A 36-page, full-color manual guides you through model building with step-by-step illustrated instructions.
